title: Nobel claim: Sorry Trump, even AI isn't buying it
description: AI chatbots, including ChatGPT, Gemini, and Grok, have largely dismissed Donald Trump's claim of deserving a Nobel Peace Prize for ending seven wars. Experts and the AI models found his assertions disputed, vague, or exaggerated, highlighting a lack of solid evidence for truly ending conflicts. While acknowledging some de-escalatory efforts, they deem them insufficient for the prestigious award.

Her death, caused by suffocation from neck compression, was inflicted by a fan who had developed an obsession and financial troubles. The incident highlights the dangers of fan communities and influencer security.

title: Google changes work policy: ‘Work From Anywhere’ can’t be used for WFH; sends memo

title: India-UK CEO Forum: PM Modi, Starmer chart 'roadmap for shared progress'
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and UK PM Keir Starmer addressed the India-UK CEO Forum, highlighting the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) and its potential to double bilateral trade to $112 billion by 2030. The leaders emphasized CETA's role in enhancing market access, strengthening MSMEs, and fostering collaboration in commerce, education, technology, and aspirations, building on existing strong economic ties.

Officials confirmed that both pilots and any passengers aboard emerged unharmed from the incident. Visuals from the scene indicate surprisingly minor damage to the aircraft, with its wings and propeller appearing intact, though the front of the jet is noticeably angled downwards.

title: When is Diwali? Schools to remain closed for 5 days including Dhanteras and Bhai Dooj
description: Diwali school holidays in 2025 will span five days from October 18 to October 23, covering Dhanteras, Narak Chaturdashi, Chhoti Diwali, Diwali, Govardhan Puja and Bhai Dooj. Schools across several states will remain closed during this festive period, providing students an extended break. Parents should check with their child’s school as holiday dates may differ by region and management. This long festive break allows families to celebrate traditional events and spend quality time together.

The court questioned the rationale behind age limits for surrogacy, especially when none exist for natural procreation.

He highlighted the city's population surge and the challenges of managing traffic, garbage, and water. Shivakumar urged stronger civic responsibility, noting that indifference and illegal dumping hinder progress. New administrative structures aim for better governance.

The agreement includes the release of all hostages held by Hamas in exchange for Palestinian prisoners and an Israeli troop withdrawal. This development aims to end the ongoing conflict and facilitate humanitarian aid.

Inside Coldrif plant: Rusty equipment among 364 violations; deadly lapses exposed
description: Madhya Pradesh police arrested Sresan Pharmaceuticals owner G Ranganathan, 73, in Chennai after his cough syrup, Coldrif, was linked to 21 child deaths due to toxic chemicals. The company, despite operating with numerous violations for years, is now under national scrutiny, with its manufacturing unit sealed.

title: No surprise: 12 pedestrians die every week in Delhi
description: The Supreme Court's order to prioritize pedestrians highlights Delhi's dangerous streets, where footpaths are encroached and vehicles dominate. Despite efforts, pedestrian safety remains a critical issue, with thousands injured or killed annually. The city's infrastructure is largely vehicle-centric, forcing pedestrians and cyclists into hazardous situations.

title: IPS officer 'suicide' case: Wife claims husband faced 'years of humiliation'; mystery note in focus
description: Wife of deceased IPS officer Y Puran Kumar, IAS officer Amneet P Kumar, has lodged a complaint seeking FIR against Haryana DGP Shatrujeet Singh Kapur and Rohtak SP Narendra Bijarnia for abetment to suicide and SC/ST Act violations. She alleges her husband faced systematic persecution and humiliation due to his caste, pushing him to suicide.

title: 'Burned while asleep': South Delhi man attacked with hot oil and chilli powder by wife
description: A shocking incident unfolded in South Delhi's Madangir where a woman allegedly doused her sleeping husband with hot oil and chilli powder. The 28-year-old man sustained burn injuries and is undergoing treatment. Police have registered a case under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code, and an investigation is ongoing into the disturbing domestic dispute.

title: Manipur alert: 9-foot rocket weighing 200kg recovered in Churachandpur
description: Security forces in Churachandpur district unearthed a substantial 9-foot-long country-made rocket, packed with 200kg of explosives and a detonator. This discovery echoes past rocket attacks by Kuki militants, including a fatal incident last September.  Four similar rockets were also found in the region last November, highlighting ongoing security concerns.

title: Zubeen Garg death: Footage of arrested trio to be deleted from singer's last film
description: Director Rajesh Bhuyan announced the removal of footage featuring individuals arrested in connection with Zubeen Garg's death from his final film, 'Roi Roi Binale.' This decision follows public backlash over the appearance of Zubeen's bandmate Shekhar Jyoti Goswami and others in the film's promotional song. The director stated that nothing displeasing to the public would be included in Zubeen's film.
